clean_content:
Definition / general

* An area of sclerotic bone related to chronic osteomyelitis that is present at root of tooth ([J Mass Dent Soc 2003;52:52](12723214))* Tooth often demonstrates pulpitis or pulpal necrosis or previous restoration ([J Mass Dent Soc 2003;52:52](12723214), [J Endod 2013;39:977](23880262))

Essential features

* Dense sclerotic bone, seen radiographically, in area of a tooth with pulpitis or previous restoration* Lesion resolves with treatment of affected tooth

Terminology

* Focal sclerosing osteomyelitis ([J Mass Dent Soc 2003;52:52](12723214))

ICD coding

* ICD-10: [M27.2](https://www.icd10data.com/ICD10CM/Codes/M00-M99/M26-M27/M27-/M27.2) - inflammatory conditions of jaws

Epidemiology

* 4 - 7% of population ([J Endod 2013;39:977](23880262))* Early adolescence / young adults but can be any age ([J Mass Dent Soc 2003;52:52](12723214))* Mandible more frequently than maxilla ([J Mass Dent Soc 2003;52:52](12723214))

Sites

* Oral cavity, mandible or maxilla, root of tooth ([J Endod 2013;39:977](23880262))

Pathophysiology

* Related to chronic inflammation of pulp of tooth causing sclerotic bone formation ([J Mass Dent Soc 2003;52:52](12723214))

Etiology

* Longstanding or low intensity infection with chronic inflammation and trabecular bone formation ([J Mass Dent Soc 2003;52:52](12723214), [J Endod 2013;39:977](23880262))

Clinical features

* Only clinical finding may be degenerative pulp disease ([J Endod 2013;39:977](23880262))

Diagnosis

* Diagnosis made by imaging of jaw

Radiology description

* Diffuse radiopaque borders concentrically arranged around root apex ([J Endod 2013;39:977](23880262))

Radiology images

Contributed by Molly Housley Smith, D.M.D. and John Kalmar, D.M.D., Ph.D.  

[![Apical to carious teeth ](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillacondensingosteitissmith05.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillacondensingosteitissmith05.jpg)

Apical to carious teeth

[![Residual opacity](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillacondensingosteitissmith06.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillacondensingosteitissmith06.jpg)

Residual opacity

[![Panorex image, condensing osteitis](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillacondensingosteitiskalmar_01.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillacondensingosteitiskalmar_01.jpg)

Panorex

  
  
Images hosted on other servers:  

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/mandiblemaxillacondensingosteitis_adaa01.png)](https://adaa.cdeworld.com/media/14448)

Periapical

Prognostic factors

* Most regress after treatment of affected tooth

Case reports

* 23 year old woman, 27 year old man and 32 year old woman with radiopaque apical lesions ([Bratisl Lek Listy 2009;110:713](http://bmj.fmed.uniba.sk/2009/11011-10.pdf))* 28 year old man with radiopaque lesion on routine imaging ([Tex Dent J 2003;120:178](12674967))
    * 57 year old woman with pain in right maxillary anterior region after extraction of upper left incisor ([J Mass Dent Soc 2003;52:52](12723214))

Treatment

* Treatment of infection in affected tooth with hopeful regression after root canal therapy or extraction ([J Mass Dent Soc 2003;52:52](12723214))

Gross description

* Bone, often fragmented

Frozen section description

* Frozen section not performed

Microscopic (histologic) description

* Replacement of cancellous bone with compact bone ([J Endod 2013;39:977](23880262))* Scant fibrous tissue ([J Mass Dent Soc 2003;52:52](12723214))* Often no obvious inflammation ([J Endod 2013;39:977](23880262), [J Mass Dent Soc 2003;52:52](12723214))

Microscopic (histologic) images

Contributed by Molly Housley Smith, D.M.D.  

[![Scant fibrous stroma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillacondensingosteitissmith01.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillacondensingosteitissmith01.jpg)

Scant fibrous stroma

[![Nonspecific bone](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillacondensingosteitissmith02.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillacondensingosteitissmith02.jpg)

Nonspecific bone

[![Remodeling bone](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillacondensingosteitissmith03.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillacondensingosteitissmith03.jpg)

Remodeling bone

[![Prominent resting and reversal lines](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillacondensingosteitissmith04.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/mandiblemaxillacondensingosteitissmith04.jpg)

Prominent resting and reversal lines

Positive stains

* Morphologic and clinical diagnosis, no stains needed

Negative stains

* Morphologic and clinical diagnosis, no stains needed

Sample pathology report

* Mandible, partial mandibulectomy:
  + Sclerotic bone consistent with condensing osteitis

Differential diagnosis

* **Idiopathic sclerosis**:
  + Not inflammatory or neoplastic+ Intraosseous radiopacity of noninflammatory trabecular bone* [Cemento-osseous dysplasia](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/mandiblemaxillafloridcemento.html):
    + May demonstrate multiple foci+ Cellular fibrovascular connective tissue with mixture of bone and cementum-like particles+ Radiographically characterized by radiolucency or radiopacity surrounded by radiolucency* [Osteoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/mandiblemaxillaosteoma.html):
      + May be associated with [Gardner syndrome](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/colontumorgardner.html), particularly when multiple+ Demonstrates expansion / growth over time with possible displacement of teeth+ No association with inflammation

Additional references

* [Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol 1984;57:195](6583626)
